{"step_by_step_thinking": "Primary cartilaginous joints, also known as synchondroses, are a type of joint where the bones are united by hyaline cartilage. Symphyses are secondary cartilaginous joints where the bones are joined by fibrocartilage. Syndesmosis is a type of fibrous joint where the bones are connected by a ligament. Synarthroses are an immovable joint.", "answer_choice": "B. Synchondrosis."}
